definition[0]: if you have a shareholding in a business, you own shares in it
example[0]: In 1992, United Distillers acquired a 75% shareholding in the company.
definition[1]: a quantity of shares in a company held by a particular person or organization
example[1]: Shareholders can protect themselves from hostile takeovers by not agreeing to sell their shareholdings at a discount.
example[2]: He has now acquired a 51% shareholding in the group.
